episodeTitle: Capriccio for Despair! The Impending Doom of Sky Island!
description: As Enel begins his devastating attack on Skypiea, the Straw Hats desperately work to reunite and escape. Despite Sanji's heroic sabotage of the Ark Maxim, Enel activates backup systems using extinct Jet Dials, continuing his plan to destroy the sky islands with massive lightning strikes.

events.title: Sanji's Heroic Sacrifice Against Enel
events.description: Sanji intercepts Enel's God's Judgment attack meant for Nami, taking the full force of the lightning strike. Despite being severely injured, he remains standing long enough to taunt Enel before collapsing, revealing that he sabotaged the Ark Maxim's propulsion systems.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's willingness to sacrifice himself to protect his crewmates, particularly Nami. His sabotage temporarily disrupts Enel's plans and buys the Straw Hats precious time.

quotes.text: The face of defeat... it's in your future.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's cryptic warning to Enel before passing out, foreshadowing Luffy's eventual victory

events.title: Ark Maxim's Jet Dial Backup System Revealed
events.description: After discovering Sanji's sabotage, Enel reveals that the Ark Maxim has a backup propulsion system powered by 200 extinct Jet Dials from his destroyed homeland of Bilka. This backup can keep the ship airborne for an additional hour.
events.significance: Reveals important information about Enel's past and his homeland Bilka, which he destroyed. The extinct Jet Dials represent advanced Sky Island technology that no longer exists, emphasizing Enel's ruthlessness in destroying his own birthplace.

quotes.text: These 200 Jet Dials from Bilka... they're extinct now, but they'll keep my ship in the air for another hour.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel explaining the backup systems after discovering the sabotage

events.title: Usopp Rescues Sanji from the Ark Maxim
events.description: Using his Usopp Hopping spring shoes and grappling hook, Usopp bravely returns to the Ark Maxim to rescue the unconscious Sanji. He successfully retrieves Sanji and they both fall toward the island clouds below, where they land safely.
events.significance: Shows Usopp overcoming his fear to save his crewmate, demonstrating his growth and courage. This heroic act contrasts with his usual cowardly behavior and strengthens the bond between the Straw Hat crew members.

quotes.text: Don't worry Sanji! Nami landed safely! Now let's get out of here!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp reassuring the unconscious Sanji as he rescues him

events.title: Straw Hats Reunite in Upper Yard
events.description: Nami rescues Usopp and Sanji with her Waver, bringing them to the ruins of the Golden City where they reunite with the rest of the Straw Hat crew, Aisa, Wyper, and Gan Fall.
events.significance: The crew comes together during the crisis, preparing for their final confrontation with Enel and the evacuation of Skypiea. Nami thanks the unconscious Sanji for saving her life.

quotes.text: Thank you, Sanji... for saving me.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami expressing gratitude to the still-unconscious Sanji

events.title: Enel Begins Deathpiea - The Destruction of Skypiea
events.description: Enel commences his ultimate attack called 'Deathpiea,' unleashing massive thunderclouds that rain down devastating lightning strikes across Angel Island and Upper Yard. Buildings are destroyed, trees burn, and the sky islands face total annihilation.
events.significance: This marks the climax of Enel's plan to destroy Skypiea and represents one of the most destructive attacks in the series up to this point. The mass evacuation becomes desperate as entire communities face obliteration.

quotes.text: Let the final gala begin! Deathpiea!
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel announcing the beginning of his destructive attack on Skypiea

events.title: Mass Evacuation of Sky Island Residents
events.description: As lightning strikes intensify, the citizens of Angel Island and the Shandians desperately flee from Upper Yard. Conis, Pagaya, and other Sky Island residents attempt to reach safety while destruction rains down around them.
events.significance: Shows the consequences of Enel's tyranny and the desperation of the Sky Island inhabitants. This evacuation drives home the stakes of the conflict and emphasizes why Luffy must defeat Enel.

events.title: Nami Decides to Help Luffy
events.description: Despite the danger, Nami makes the decision to ride her Waver up the giant beanstalk to help Luffy in his pursuit of Enel, expressing concern about how Luffy will fight an enemy who can fly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's loyalty to Luffy and her willingness to risk her life for her captain. This decision sets up her role in the final battle against Enel.

quotes.text: How is Luffy supposed to fight someone who can fly?
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami worrying about Luffy's chances against Enel as she rides up the beanstalk

events.title: Wyper Recalls Kalgara and the Golden Bell
events.description: As destruction rains down on his homeland, Wyper remembers his childhood and how his chief explained why their ancestor Kalgara had to retake their home and ring the Golden Bell - it was a promise to his friend Mont Blanc Noland.
events.significance: This flashback deepens the emotional weight of the Skypiea conflict by revealing the 400-year-old promise between Kalgara and Noland. It explains the Shandians' desperate fight to reclaim their homeland and reinforces the theme of inherited will.

events.title: Luffy Pursues Enel Up the Giant Beanstalk
events.description: Determined to stop Enel's destruction, Luffy races up the massive beanstalk while still carrying the giant golden ball attached to his arm. He shouts warnings at Enel that he won't get away with destroying Skypiea.
events.significance: Sets up the final confrontation between Luffy and Enel. The golden ball on Luffy's arm will prove to be both a hindrance and ultimately a crucial element in defeating Enel.

quotes.text: Enel! You won't get away with this!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy shouting at Enel while climbing the beanstalk

quotes.text: The face of defeat... it's in your future.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's cryptic warning to Enel after taking his lightning attack

quotes.text: These 200 Jet Dials from Bilka... they're extinct now, but they'll keep my ship in the air for another hour.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel revealing the backup systems of the Ark Maxim

quotes.text: Let the final gala begin! Deathpiea!
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel announcing the beginning of his destructive attack

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami expressing gratitude to the unconscious Sanji

themes.description: Sanji's willingness to take a potentially fatal attack to save Nami, and Usopp's courage in rescuing him, demonstrate the deep bonds of friendship and loyalty within the Straw Hat crew.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's cigarette remaining lit after the lightning strike symbolizes his indomitable spirit and determination.

themes.description: Wyper's flashback to Kalgara and Noland's friendship reinforces the theme of promises that transcend generations, connecting the past struggle to the present conflict.
themes.symbolism: The Golden Bell represents the unbroken promise between two friends separated by time and circumstance.

themes.description: Enel's godlike destruction of Skypiea contrasts with the desperate struggle of the people for freedom and survival, emphasizing the cost of unchecked power.
themes.symbolism: The lightning strikes represent divine judgment and tyrannical oppression, while the evacuation represents the people's will to survive.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji demonstrates his chivalrous nature and strategic thinking by both protecting Nami and sabotaging the Ark Maxim simultaneously.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the evacuation scenes and shows more destruction from Deathpiea compared to the manga.
The anime adds additional dialogue and reactions from Sky Island residents during the evacuation.

trivia.fact: The Jet Dials from Bilka are described as extinct, making them incredibly rare. This is one of the few mentions of Enel's destroyed homeland in the anime.
Episode 186 achieved a TV rating of 11.3%, ranking 6th for its time slot, showing the Skypiea Arc's popularity in Japan.
The title 'Capriccio' is a musical term referring to a lively, free-spirited composition, which ironically contrasts with the desperate and destructive nature of Enel's attack.
This episode marks the beginning of Deathpiea, one of the most destructive attacks seen in the series up to this point in the anime.
